alert.note: Alert for Henry; Mercer; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 3:25PM CDT until April 20 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Warren County in west central Illinois... Southeastern Mercer County in northwestern Illinois... Southwestern Henry County in northwestern Illinois... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 325 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Alexis, or 12 miles southeast of Aledo, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... North Henderson around 330 PM CDT. New Windsor and Griffin around 335 PM CDT. New Windsor and Alpha around 340 PM CDT. Woodhull and Ophiem around 345 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Andover, Lynn Center, Nekoma, Cambridge, Bishop Hill, Henry County Fairgrounds, Ulah and German Corner. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern and west central Illinois.
